author: paulhauner
content: Has there been any decision made about the devnet using pre/post Altair beacon chain?

author: raulj
content: will be tough on the Prysm side as we have unique engineering challenges that make it hard for us to implement Altair in time

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> No Altair yet in merge testing for now. Even the latest merge specs don't integrate those changes yet. We will rebase the work onto the Altair fork when it's more stable.

author: paulhauner
content: I would expect pre-Altair, since we've never done an Altair testnet before and it seems like a lot of overhead to require all teams to be Altair-ready. Also, doing our first Altair testnet in a hackathon whilst we're also doing merge seems like a lot to bite off.

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Yes, fully agree, we should not couple Altair and Merge too closely until either one is stable and tested

author: paulhauner
content: It is a shame to do a pre-Altair merge though, cause it's not going to accurately reflect the genesis->altair->merge scenario and the devnets we make here aren't going to be relevant once we're in Altair territory.

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> It's not until we have the actual fork transition integrated. Just getting a post-merge prototype running at all is very important to progress on the eth1 side. Once it's running, we can move away from eth2 prototype code, and look at fork-transition approach, and Altair rebase (when the time comes)
